intro: Pilea aripoensis, commonly known as the Aripo pilea, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, specifically Venezuela. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle plants, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in the spring. Pilea aripoensis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and relatively easy care requirements.
